page.title: 01Old Dalby
page.content: Old Dalby,or Dalby on the Wolds, is in a picturesque valley encircled by some of the highest hills which bound the edge of the Vale of Belvoir. The village is 7mls.N.W.of Melton Mowbray and 10mls.N.E. of Loughborough.The is in the E.Goscote Hundred and has about 800 people living in it. The village is surrounded by farmland which is mainly either grassland used for fattening cattle or grazing sheep, or arable land.The farmers employ very few people because they use machines for most of the work on the farm. The population is now made up of commuters who mainly work in Leicester Nottingham or Loughborough;local people who work closer to the village, in Melton or at the nearby R.E.M.E.camp;and many old people who used to work in small local firms which no longer exist.
